originalText.text: I took the Reformer Class with Lauren, and it was absolutely wonderful! I felt that every part of my body had a chance to work out without feeling exhausted. It was my first time ever, so I was a little bit nervous, but Lauren explained every exercise very well and showed everything. I 100% recommend it! ❤️

It was my first time ever, so I was a little bit nervous, but Lauren explained every exercise very well and showed everything. I 100% recommend it! ❤️

originalText.text:
The best Pilates studio! All of their teachers are really qualified and teach challenging Pilates classes. (Although if you are a beginner they break things down really well, so I would recommend it for all levels!)

The studio is clean, updated, and airy! The outdoor deck is a highlight in the nice weather! I have taken Kevin, Lydia, and Liz’s classes and they are all excellent teachers! They are very well-trained and know what they are doing. I got in the best shape doing Pilates! It is the only thing I’ve done my whole life that has given me ab definition. Amazing! I recommend going 3-4 times a week.

originalText.text:
Regarding Reformer Class with Kevin
This instructor has the WORST demeanor l've ever encountered. I'm an experienced Pilates practitioner & frequent Power Pilates at least 2-3x/week at their other location. But had this instructor been my first encounter with the studio, it would have 100% been my last.

I was late exactly 5 mins on a Saturday because of a subway delay. He threw his hands up, raised his voice, made a big hoopla & REFUSED to let me take the class! This is even though there was only one other student there! ONE STUDENT! This wasn’t some big class being interrupted!

I’ve taken several classes at Power Pilates where AN INSTRUCTOR was late 10 even 15 mins!! Conversely, I’ve taken small classes where the instructor waited a few mins to start for others to join. It’s all been fine! This is NYC after all! But this guy, he’s some obnoxious diva who thinks he’s something special! He frankly has no business teaching ANYTHING with that attitude! Avoid him unless you’d like your Pilates with a side of massive ego.

As for the business, Power Pilates needs to come up with CLEAR class lateness policy because this is not ok! You either tolerate NO lateness for both your students & instructors, or set & communicate a specific time window that is acceptable. Having a double standard & just winging it is incredibly unprofessional! It leaves a very bad taste.

originalText.text: Great class today. We had Mat class outdoors on the terrace which was a  nice way to start the day. The instructor, Kevin was as engaging as he was funny.

text.text: Great class today. We had Mat class outdoors on the terrace which was a  nice way to start the day. The instructor, Kevin was as engaging as he was funny.

originalText.text:
Kevin has changed my life.
I have been taking class exclusively with Kevin for the past 14 months, he quite simply has changed my life and helped me get to a level of health.

Kevin never coddles me, but takes the time to understand my needs and gently pushes me to expand and succeed. In class he lifts us all with his wicked sense of humor as his eagle eye monitors us so he can offer improvements.

Also, Kevin has never once been late and he is very serious about safety especially when on the tower or reformer as he does not want injuries so he does expect you to be timely.

I have seen him work with people who are slightly late to make sure they can take the class and was shocked to read an immature customer take out their frustrations for being late (doubtful it was only 5 minutes) on Kevin - maybe they needs a hug or should be come a fantasy writer as their account I have not once experienced or observed in over 160 visits during the last 14 months.

While I most go to private and tower classes at the other location, love how this Flat Iron studio is so nice and bright.
